title: Root says 'silly' to change England management after Ashes loss
byline: Veteran England batsman Joe Root has said it would be ’’silly’’ to change England’s management team after losing the Ashes, with players ’’absolutely committed’’ to the current set-up.

title: CR overcome Police fightback to secure 46-22 win
byline: CR & FC endured a stern second-half challenge but held their nerve to record a 46-22 bonus-point victory over Sri Lanka Police Sports Club in their Inter-Club League rugby encounter played at Police Park last evening. CR scored through 7 tries, 4 conversions, and 1 penalty to Police’s 2 tries, 1 penalty try, 1 conversion, and 1 penalty.

title: India reach new highs in build-up towards 2026 T20 World Cup
byline: A power-packed batting display helped India go 4-0 up in the five match T20I series against Sri Lanka.

title: Former England cricket boss Morris dies aged 62
byline: Glamorgan announced the death of Hugh Morris, the former chief executive of the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB), at the age of 62 on Sunday.

title: 700 kmph in 2 seconds: China sets world record with high-speed maglev train
byline: Chinese scientists have achieved a milestone in magnetic levitation technology. Researchers at China’s National University of Defence Technology successfully propelled a one-tonne vehicle to 700 kilometers per hour in just two seconds on a 400-meter test track, setting a new world record for superconducting electric maglev systems.

title: Jumbo deaths continue, wild elephant electrocuted
byline: The death of another wild elephant in the human-elephant conflict was reported yesterday from Handapanagala in Moneragala. The wild elephant that roamed into the village had been electrocuted when it attempted to enter a cultivated land at Kottagashandiya area in Handapanagala. The carcass had been recovered by the wildlife officers who arrived on information from the residents of the area.

title: Police intensify raids on illegal brothels disguised as spas in Colombo
byline: Police have intensified raids on brothels allegedly operating under the guise of spas in Colombo, after dozens of foreign women were arrested in December alone for involvement in illegal activities in Sri Lanka.

title: Jaffna international cricket stadium goes for a six
byline: ITAK General Secretary M. A. Sumanthiran told media that the land which was allocated for the international cricket stadium has gone under water during the recent floods.

title: Why no websites for transparency for billions of donor funds?
byline: Cyclone Ditwah has left in its trail an unprecedented humanitarian and economic crisis involving all 25 districts. Sri Lanka will be hard pressed to get out of this crisis unless leaders from all sections of the polity demonstrate mature leadership and superior management skills devoid of corruption and partisan politics. Given our collective track record, it will be a miracle for this to come to pass.

title: Irrigation Department to inspect 266 tank aqueducts after floods
byline: The Irrigation Department has begun preparations to carry out an assessment inspection of 266 tank aqueducts following damage caused by recent floods triggered by heavy rainfall.

title: Sri Lanka ranked fifth among Asia’s best places to visit for 2026
byline: Sri Lanka has secured the fifth position among the Best Places to Visit in Asia for 2026, according to rankings released by U.S. News & World Report, placing the island nation alongside some of the continent’s most iconic destinations such as Mount Fuji, Tokyo, Palawan, and Seoul.

title: Mexico train crash kills 13 and injures almost 100
byline: At least 13 people died and almost 100 were injured after a train derailed in Mexico’s south-western Oaxaca region, the Mexican navy said.

title: All our home matches will be played only at Nittawela: Mahesh Weerasinghe
byline: Kandy Sports Club has issued a firm and detailed response to the recent Sri Lanka Rugby (SLR) press release concerning the controversial Kandy SC vs CH & FC Inter-Club League fixture, strongly rejecting allegations of misconduct by its supporters and reaffirming its commitment to player and official safety. The letter has been sent by President, Kandy SC, Mahesh Weerasinghe, as below.

title: Root says 'silly' to change England management after Ashes loss
byline: Veteran England batsman Joe Root has said it would be ’’silly’’ to change England’s management team after losing the Ashes, with players ’’absolutely committed’’ to the current set-up.

title: Former England cricket boss Morris dies aged 62
byline: Glamorgan announced the death of Hugh Morris, the former chief executive of the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB), at the age of 62 on Sunday.

title: Tourist arrivals in Sri Lanka hit all-time high
byline: Sri Lanka has recorded its highest-ever annual tourist arrivals, with the 2,333,797th visitor for 2025 arriving at Bandaranaike International Airport.

title: Airport employees protest over 2025 year-end bonuses
byline: Around 500 airport employees staged a protest at airport premises today, demanding the payment of five basic salaries from the year-end bonus announced for 2025 by the Chairman of the Airport and Aviation Services Company Limited, Retired Air Vice Marshal Harsha Abeywickrama.

title: Customs records highest-ever revenue
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has recorded a historic high in revenue collection, earning Rs. 2,497 billion during the year, Customs Media Spokesman Chandana Punchihewa said.

title: Government to import seeds, vegetables after Cyclone Ditwah damage: Farmers’ Union
byline: The government is preparing to import seeds and vegetables following the severe damage caused to the agricultural sector by Cyclone Ditwah, National Farmers’ Union Chairman Anuradha Thennakoon said.

title: Cinnamon Grand clarifies no police complaint filed over Ne-Yo concert
byline: Cinnamon Grand Colombo said that it has not filed, initiated, or participated in any police complaint, legal action, or administrative process in connection with the Ne-Yo concert or its organizers.

title: Kandy MC decides to remove pavement hawkers
byline: The Kandy Municipal Council has decided to remove all pavement hawkers in the city after December 31. Mayor of Kandy Chandrasiri Wijenayake said the decision to remove payment hawkers had been taken in June this year, but they were given time till December 31 on sympathetic grounds.

title: Mexico train crash kills 13 and injures almost 100
byline: At least 13 people died and almost 100 were injured after a train derailed in Mexico’s south-western Oaxaca region, the Mexican navy said.

title: Free Lawyers’ Association to file Supreme Court petition over lack of cyclone “Ditwah” warnings
byline: The Free Lawyers’ Association, representing the Joint Opposition, has announced plans to file a petition before the Supreme Court by January 15, challenging the government’s failure to inform the public in advance about the dangers of cyclone “Ditwah” and to take proper safety measures.

title: Alongside India, China is set to play role in post-disaster rebuilding process
byline: Alongside India, China is also likely to play a key role in Sri Lanka’s post-disaster rebuilding efforts, according to a top source.

title: Opposition unite to oppose suppression of media
byline: The opposition political parties have opposed the government’s move to take action against media which had reported on the recent disaster.

title: 700 kmph in 2 seconds: China sets world record with high-speed maglev train
byline: Chinese scientists have achieved a milestone in magnetic levitation technology. Researchers at China’s National University of Defence Technology successfully propelled a one-tonne vehicle to 700 kilometers per hour in just two seconds on a 400-meter test track, setting a new world record for superconducting electric maglev systems.

title: One dead after mid-air helicopter collision in New Jersey
byline: One person has died and another suffered critical injuries after two helicopters collided mid-air on Sunday above a city in New Jersey, local police said.

title: Bhutan bowler sets T20 record with eight wickets
byline: The left-arm spinner became the only bowler to pick up an eight-wicket haul in the shortest format.

title: Minister proposes Chinese support for islandwide EV charging network
byline: Foreign Affairs Minister Vijitha Herath has proposed that China support the installation of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations across Sri Lanka as a donation, in line with the country’s plans to import electric vehicles in large numbers, including from China.

title: ICC rates MCG pitch ’unsatisfactory’ after two-day Test
byline: The Melbourne Cricket Ground’s seam-friendly pitch for the fourth Ashes Test was rated ’’unsatisfactory’’ Monday by the International Cricket Council after it ended inside two days.

title: Highway revenue rises during festive season
byline: Highway toll revenue recorded a notable increase during the Christmas season and ongoing school holidays, driven by a surge in vehicle movement across the country.

title: COPE, COPA cannot function without Auditor General: Opposition MP
byline: The Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) and the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) cannot function after January 6, 2026 without an Auditor General, Opposition MP Dayasiri Jayasekera said today.

title: Boxer Anthony Joshua hurt in fatal two-vehicle crash
byline: Former heavyweight boxing champion Anthony Joshua was involved in a car accident in Nigeria in which two people were killed, authorities confirmed Monday.

title: Nalin Wewakumbura assumes duties as new SLAF Media Spokesperson
byline: Group Captain Nalin Wewakumbura has assumed duties as the new Media Spokesperson of the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) with effect from 26 December 2025.

title: Construction of Jaffna Stadium underway: SLC
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) announced today that work towards building the Jaffna International Cricket Stadium (JICS) in Mandaitivu, Jaffna, is currently ongoing and progressing as planned.

title: T-56 firearm thrown into private institution, two remanded, one granted bail
byline: Two suspects were remanded till January 8 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Nuwan Kaushalya today in connection with an incident involving the throwing of a T-56 firearm into a private institution.

title: Post cyclone deaths more in many instances: Research
byline: Post Cyclone deaths have been found to be more than the number of persons killed in a cyclone itself, a research has revealed.

title: Sinister plan to attack Buddhist temple in North and create communal unrest: Archchuna
byline: There is a sinister plan by some Tamil MPs representing the North to attack a Buddhist temple in the North around January 3 and create communal unrest, MP Ramanathan Archchuna said today.

title: EPF services go digital with launch of online registration system
byline: The online registration of institutions and members under the digitalisation of Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) services commenced today (29), marking a key step in modernising labour-related services in Sri Lanka.

title: ID office system crashes, applicants asked to return
byline: The newly introduced digital system at the Department for Registration of Persons (DRP) experienced repeated technical failures today, forcing applicants seeking National Identity Cards (NICs) to suspend their visits and return tomorrow.

title: Market closes mixed after early rally
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) concluded Monday’s session on a mixed note following an eventful day of trading. The market opened with strong positive momentum, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) rallying to the 22,200 level, gaining as much as 135 points intraday, before easing into a sideways trajectory and closing modestly higher.

title: Sri Lanka can achieve US$ 300 billion economy by 2030 despite cyclone Ditwah: Industries Ministry
byline: Sri Lanka has the potential to become more resilient and grow into a US$ 300 billion economy by 2030, despite facing severe natural disasters such as Cyclone Ditwah, Secretary to the Ministry of Industries and Entrepreneurship Development, Ms. Thilaka Jayasundara, said today (29).

title: Online reservation facility for holiday bungalows launched
byline: Taking forward the government’s digital governance policy, an online reservation facility for holiday bungalows and rest houses under the Public Administration Ministry was launched today (29) under the patronage of the Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister Prof. Chandana Abeyratne.

title: Mahanayake Thera requests President to reschedule Vesak Day for May 30
byline: Mahanayake Theras of the four Chapters have requested the government to revise the date of Vesak in 2026 because there will be two full-moon days in May.
